bestBHT.bht: Being led by the Spirit of God is a defining characteristic of the sons of God, signifying a deeper, more conscious relationship with Him. This guidance serves as evidence of piety, as those who yield to the Spirit's influence demonstrate a desire to walk in purity and life. Through the sanctifying work of the Spirit, believers are set apart as heirs of eternal life. This divine leading is a testament to God's gracious and loving guidance, ultimately leading them from sin to the righteousness found in Christ.

Henry Alford: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are sons of God."
A son of God differs from a child of God, in implying the higher and more mature, and conscious member of God’s family.
This latter, applied to a Christian, signifies ‘one born of God’ in the deepest relation to Him,— and hence a partaker of His nature.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.
He speaks of Him as a gracious, loving Guide, whose 'leading'—enjoyed by all in whom is the Spirit of God's dear Son—shows that they also are 'sons of God'.
Albert Barnes: One evidence of piety is, a willingness to yield to [the Spirit's] influence, and submit to him.
The influence of the Spirit, if followed, would lead every man to heaven. But when neglected, rejected, or despised, man goes down to hell.

This is a test of piety which is easily applied... Are we conscious of a desire to yield to that influence, and to be conducted in the path of purity and life? This is an evidence that we are the sons of God.
Marvin Vincent: Sons [υιοι] . See on John 1:12; Matthew 1:1. There is an implied contrast with the Jewish idea of sonship by physical descent.
John Calvin: all those are the sons of God who are led by God’s Spirit; all the sons of God are heirs of eternal life: then all who are led by God’s Spirit ought to feel assured of eternal life."

But it is right to observe, that the working of the Spirit is various: for there is that which is universal, by which all creatures are sustained and preserved; there is that also which is peculiar to men, and varying in its character: but what he means here is sanctification, with which the Lord favors none but his own elect, and by which he separates them for sons to himself.
Thus we are reminded of our misery and weakness; and we ought not to ascribe to ourselves either knowledge or strength apart from the Spirit of God.
Philip Schaff: This introduces the reason why we ‘shall live,’ indicating again that the mortifying (Romans 8:13) is the work of the Holy Spirit.
Led by the Spirit of God; continuously and specially moved by the Spirit, in their whole life.
These are sons of God. These, and none other.
Archibald T. Robertson: In the special sense here only those are 'sons of God' who are led by the Spirit of God."
Those born again (the second birth) both Jews and Gentiles, 'the sons of Abraham,' the children of faith."
But in the widest sense all men are 'the offspring' of God.
John Gill: the Spirit of God leads them from sin, and from a dependence on their own righteousness, in paths they formerly knew not
the Spirit of God leads them to the person, blood, and righteousness of Christ, and to the fulness of grace in him
this blessing of being the sons of God, is owing not to ourselves, nor to our earthly parents, but to God
John Wesley: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God — In all the ways of righteousness.
They are the sons of God — Here St. Paul enters upon the description of those blessings which he comprises, Romans 8:30, in the word glorified.
The sum is, through sufferings to glory.

bhtAttempts.bht: As many as are led by the Spirit of God are the sons of God. This means that they are the higher and more mature members of God's family, deeply connected to Him and sharing in His nature. The Spirit of God serves as a loving guide, leading them in the paths of righteousness. This leading is a characteristic of those who are truly born of God, and it distinguishes them from those who rely on physical descent or outward religious observance. Ultimately, being led by the Spirit is a test of piety and a willingness to submit to His influence. It is through the sanctifying work of the Spirit that believers are separated as sons and heirs of eternal life.

For those who are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God. Being led by the Spirit distinguishes the mature, conscious members of God's family. It shows that they are deeply connected to Him and share in His nature. This guiding presence of the Spirit serves as a test of piety, a willingness to yield and be conducted in the path of purity and life. Through the sanctifying work of the Spirit, believers are separated as heirs of eternal life.

Those who are led by the Spirit of God are the sons of God, which sets them apart as the higher and more mature members of God's family. This guidance signifies a deep, intimate relationship with Him and a sharing of His nature. It is through this leading that believers demonstrate their piety and willingness to submit to the Spirit's influence, ultimately leading them on the path of purity and life. This work of the Spirit separates them as heirs of eternal life.

Being led by the Spirit of God is a defining characteristic of the sons of God, signifying a deeper, more conscious relationship with Him. This guidance serves as evidence of piety, as those who yield to the Spirit's influence demonstrate a desire to walk in purity and life. Through the sanctifying work of the Spirit, believers are set apart as heirs of eternal life. This divine leading is a testament to God's gracious and loving guidance, ultimately leading them from sin to the righteousness found in Christ.

Being led by the Spirit of God distinguishes the sons of God, who have a higher and more mature relationship with Him. This guiding presence is a testament to their deep connection to God and their sharing in His nature. It serves as a test of piety, where a willingness to yield to the Spirit's influence shows a desire to be led on the path of purity and life. Through the sanctifying work of the Spirit, believers are set apart as heirs of eternal life.
